flawed_nl_solution:
Since time is obtained by dividing distance and speed, then Skye took 3 km/150 km per hr. = 3/150 of an hour to finish the first 3 kilometers of the race.
His speed on the next 2 kilometers was 150 + 50 = <<150+50=200>>200 kilometers per hour.
Hence, it took him 2 km/200 km per hr. = 2/200 of an hour to finish the next 2 kilometers.
His speed on the remaining 1 kilometer is 150 x 2 = <<150*2=3000>>3000 kilometers per hour.
Hence, it took him 1/3000 of an hour to finish the 1 kilometer.
So, the total time it took for Skye to complete the race was 3/150 + 2/200 + 1/3000 = 91/3000 of an hour.
Therefore, his average speed for the entire race was 6 km/ 91/3000 hour = 18000/91 kilometers per hour.
#### 18000/91

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
